body:
I've found the solution custom comparator for enum fields 
`.withComparatorForType(comparator,Enum.class)`
We will look into that behavior, does not feel right

@joel-costigliola  thank you for you response. Let me know if you need more information. 
I use java 12 and last version from maven

Got a bit of time to look at it, the reason the test does not fail is that the `value` field in actual `Check` is compared recursively against expected. It turns out that enum fields are static and static fields are ignored in the recursive comparison since the point is to compare instances not classes.

I think ignoring static fields is valid, the issue here is that we try to compare enum recursively when they should be compared with equals (or == since it's the same for enum) .

issue.title: Recursive assertions fail for nested enum types

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Summary

I have two types, an entity and a DTO, and they have a field called 'status', which are of different types but otherwise have identical constants. When using:

    assertThat(entity)
            .usingRecursiveComparison()
            .ignoringAllOverriddenEquals()
            .isEqualTo(dto)

differences between the enum fields are not reported. I debugged a bit and turns out the 'equals' method is ignored for the fields (correctly, as I used 'ignoringAllOverriddenEquals') and they are attempted to be compared recursively again (i.e. their fields). There are no fields in these enums, so the difference is not reported at all.

Ignoring equals is not taken into account for Java types (https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/master/src/main/java/org/assertj/core/api/recursive/comparison/RecursiveComparisonConfiguration.java#L361)

Maybe a similar exception should be made for enums, i.e. enums should be compared by using their name? Even if there are custom fields in the enums, the name check should be enough?

issue.title: ignoringAllOverriddenEquals ignores enum actual field when expected is not enum

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM
